review: As a bit of background, there are 4 iPads, 2 iPhones, 2 iPod Touches, and a Mac Mini in my house. Because of all the iOS devices around my house and because all my media is already in iTunes on the Mac Mini. Anyway, because of all this, I made the decision to purchase the Apple TV instead of a Roku that I was looking at and so far I am very pleased. The apple TV connects easily to my itunes library and plays all of my movies and music. Using Airplay to stream music and videos off of my assorted ios devices is very nice also. Netflix and Hulu both work well on the Apple TV and there are many other "Channels" such as sports, and childrens programming that will appeal to others.In summary, if you already have your media in itunes or have ios devices this is a very good choice for a streaming device.

review: My wife and I actually now have 2 apple tv's... so it's probably surprising that I'm giving the product 2 stars, right? Well the majority of the time I like the Apple TV just fine. The main issue comes from renting movies through the Apple Store. We have one Apple TV in our living room and it seems like a basic function would be to put the movie on pause and resume playing in the other room, right? WRONG. I've literally unplugged the other Apple TV so I can just watch our silly movie in the bedroom to finish it, but guess what? That $5 you spent on a movie, you can't watch it unless you stay in your living room. Or you can go back and forth trying to log out of Apple ID's trying to get it to play. Convenience is what they are supposed to be selling with this product, but when it comes to this moving switching, it's absurd. I truly don't understand how they couldn't make this simple feature easier. I am planning on a 3rd streaming device and will be giving another brand a shot at it.
